Generation I.Red: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep .
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep .
Generation I.Yellow: Uses its alluring eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.
Generation I.Stadium: It mesmerizes with its large, round eyes and sings a soothing melody. Pokémon hearing this song fall asleep.

Generation II.Gold: If it inflates to Sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
Generation II.Silver: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.
Generation II.Crystal: It rolls its cute eyes as it sings a soothing lullaby. Its gentle song puts anyone who hears it to sleep.
Generation II.Stadium 2: If it inflates to Sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Jigglypuff 's vocal chords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pok é mon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
Generation III.Sapphire: When this Pok é mon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.
Generation III.Emerald: Nothing can avoid falling asleep hearing a Jigglypuff 's song. The sound waves of its singing voice match the brain waves of someone in a deep sleep.
Generation III.FireRed: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

Generation IV.Diamond: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Generation IV.Pearl: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Generation IV.Platinum: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Generation IV.HeartGold: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.

Generation V.Black: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Generation V.White: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Generation V.Black 2: Looking into its cute, round eyes makes it start singing a song so pleasant listeners can't help but fall asleep.
Generation V.White 2: Looking into its cute, round eyes makes it start singing a song so pleasant listeners can't help but fall asleep.

Generation VI.X: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.
Generation VI.Y: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Jigglypuff's vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When this Pokémon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.

Generation VII.Sun: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you'll become sleepy right away.
Generation VII.Moon: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual's singing skill depends on its own effort.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The songs they sing are totally different depending on the region they live in. Some even sound like they're shouting!
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.

Generation VIII.Sword: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won't stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
Generation VIII.Shield: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

Generation IX.Scarlet: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
Generation IX.Violet: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Routes 3 and 4 Safari Zone (tall grass in Meadow, default; tall grass in Swamp, default Morning Day )
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 3 and 4 Safari Zone (tall grass in Meadow, default; tall grass in Swamp, default Morning Day )

Generation VI.X: Route 20 , Pokémon Village , Friend Safari ( Fairy )
Generation VI.Y: Route 20 , Pokémon Village , Friend Safari ( Fairy )
